content: Which British author, best known for her detective novels featuring Hercule Poirot and Miss Marple, is often referred to as the "Queen of Crime"?

Agatha Christie is often referred to as the "Queen of Crime." She was a British author renowned for her detective novels and short stories, many of which feature the iconic detectives Hercule Poirot and Miss Jane Marple. Her works have had a significant impact on the crime fiction genre and have been translated into numerous languages, making her one of the best-selling authors of all time.
